Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
3/26/2021. The study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules, sections of the contract and Modified Implementation Sustainability,

compliance has been established therefore, your certificate of inspection license is
renewed.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following area.
 The facility is providing additional training on issues including updated policies
and procedures as laid out in the corrective action plans. However, they were
not requiring staff to sign into the training and losing the documentation to
prove that specific staff are being trained. This was discussed and they will
begin to require sign-in sheets for any training even if it is conducted at short
notice.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not seek consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
The facility has submitted three acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The first submitted corrective action plan was in response to the special investigation
report 2021C0214003 initiated on 10/16/2020. This involved allegations of staff
placing their hand on a resident’s neck and the other hand on the resident’s groin
area. After an investigation involving face-to-face interviews, a review of written
documentation and a review of a video recording it was determined that staff did not
provide the form of behavior management that is part of the policy/procedures for this
facility. There were additional findings that the staff did not follow the policy/procedure
of room/security checks and setting a positive role model for residents. The facility
submitted a CAP on 11/19/20 which was approved on 12/1/20. This CAP involved a
written reprimand for the staff identified, a period of 90-days for additional supervision
for the identified staff with a written evaluation at the end of the 90-days, additional
training on the policy/procedures that cover the allegations, and an updating of the
policy/procedures that cover staff providing room supervision for residents.
The second submitted corrective action plan was in response to the special
investigation report 2021C0207006 initiated on 1/13/2021. This special investigation
involved allegations of a staff member hitting a youth with an open hand. After an
investigation involving face-to-face interviews, a review of written documentation and
a review of a video recording it was determined that staff did strike the resident in the
face with the back of his hand. The facility submitted a CAP on 3/12/21 which was
approved on 3/24/21. This CAP involved a written reprimand for the identified staff,
4

updating the policy/procedure for corporal punishment, and staff training on the new
policy/procedure.
The third submitted corrective action plan was in response to the Annual Licensing
Inspection that occurred on 7/15/2020.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
